Comment: It’s more complicated than that. For instance, the Reagan airport crash may have contributing factors related to the pilots, or to ATC. But the organizations within the FAA and department of transportation that created the policies, and the waivers from those policies, that allow it to be “normal” for a helicopter to pass within 75 feet of an airliner are far removed from ATC.  An airspace design organization designs the airspace, creates the procedures, and issues a series of directions called “technical orders” that are regulatory in nature.  They create LOAs, (letters of agreement) between adjacent ATC facilities to make sure there’s coordination and coverage with no gaps.  And the role of ATC and pilots is to follow those directives, and in most cases following them is mandatory.
